The ocean is one of Earth’s largest ecosystems and helps moderate our climate. NASA has an array of missions dedicated to studying this precious part of the planet, with more to come.

Today our #NASAInterns completed their first week at @NASA. Already these #ArtemisGeneration interns are putting their talent and creativity to work for the betterment of all. 

Welcome to the team!
.@NASA_Astronauts Stephen Bowen and @Astro_Woody successfully installed and deployed the space station's fifth roll-out solar array during a six-hour and three-minute spacewalk today.
Upgrade in progress: a new solar array unrolls on the @Space_Station. It will produce more than 20 kilowatts of electricity to augment the station's power supply and support more @ISS_Research.

Time for work! @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody have switched their suits to battery power and exited the Quest airlock. Now, they’ll install a roll-out solar array on the @Space_Station.
LIVE: Spacewalk with us. Watch as @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody install a new roll-out solar array on the @Space_Station, scheduled to start at 9:15am ET.

The image from this post is by Lauren Dauphin, who used an image from @NOAA’s GOES 16 satellite and the National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service (NESDIS).

Join us for a Twitter Space! We’re celebrating 50 years of studying gamma-ray bursts, spurts of bright light coming from some of the largest explosions in the universe. Hear from experts about gamma-ray astronomy & the high-energy events that create them.

We're going on a spacewalk!

Join us tomorrow, June 9, as @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody step outside the @Space_Station. Friday's spacewalk is scheduled to start at 9:15am ET (1315 UTC), with live coverage beginning at 7:45am ET (1145 UTC) on Twitter and NASA TV.

NOW: We're holding a public meeting of our independent study team for categorizing and evaluating data of unidentified anomalous phenomena, or UAP. More info on today's meeting: https://go.nasa.gov/3nVqp7g

I just reached a milestone only surpassed by Opportunity: 30 km on Mars

Welcome back to Earth! It's been an incredible journey for the all-private astronaut crew of #Ax2. They've conducted vital scientific experiments and brought the wonders of space closer to us all. Congratulations to @SpaceX and @Axiom_Space for another successful mission!

Snacks? Go. Science? Go. Ready to soak up some rays? Go. It's not NASA beach day—we're targeting June 3 to launch the next @SpaceX cargo mission to the @Space_Station. It carries new station solar arrays.

How to watch #CRS28, from pre-launch to liftoff: https://go.nasa.gov/3MGzPMi

A team of astrophysicists and citizen scientists have identified what may be some of the final planets NASA’s retired Kepler observed during its nearly decade-long mission. They were found in the last data obtained as the telescope was running out of fuel. https://go.nasa.gov/3MEFSkw

LIVE: Listen as we discuss the science aboard the next @SpaceX cargo mission set for Saturday, June 3, sending solar arrays, small satellites, and a plant experiment to the @Space_Station. Tag questions #AskNASA.

"Congratulations on an outstanding mission."

The crew of the @Space_Station shared their thanks and farewells after Axiom Mission 2 undocked from the orbiting lab at 11:05am ET (1505 UTC). #Ax2 is scheduled to splash down off the coast of Florida tonight: https://go.nasa.gov/3MK1kUW

#Ax2 is on its way to space!
